text: Alone for speed, together for distance.
author: African Proverb

text: Great things in business are never done by one person.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Individual commitment to a group effort—that is what makes a team work.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: None of us is as smart as all of us.
author: Ken Blanchard

text: Politeness is the poison of collaboration.
author: Edwin Land

text: No one can whistle a symphony. It takes a whole orchestra to play it.
author: H.E. Luccock

text: Strategy is not a solo sport, even if you’re the CEO.
author: Max McKeown

text: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.
author: Napolean Hill

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Cooperation is the thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
author: Virginia Burden

text: Synergy is better than my way or your way. It’s our way.
author: Stephen Covey

text: The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team.
author: Phil Jackson

text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Continuous improvement is better than delayed perfection.
author: Mark Twain

text: A delayed game is eventually good, but a rushed game is forever bad.
author: Shigeru Miyamoto

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: The only way to go fast, is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

text: Don’t comment bad code—rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Focus is a matter of deciding what things you're NOT going to do.
author: John Carmack

text: Productivity is being able to do things that you were never able to do before.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.
author: Stephen King

text: You can do anything, but not everything.
author: David Allen

text: The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Absorb what is useful, discard what is not, add what is uniquely your own.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees... is by no means a waste of time.
author: Old Proverb

text: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
author: Anne Lamott

text: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
author: Ovid

text: There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither.
author: Alan Cohen

text: Resting is part of the work.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax.
author: Mark Black

text: Breathe. You're doing okay.
author: Unknown
